website_summaries.verdict: Attractive training watch ideal for swimming, cycling, running trails or the gym.
pros: Suunto Trainer tracks your activity with calories and steps 24/7
cons: Only way to extract data off the watch is through Suunto's app or website

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product. Stick with Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 6 months. The screen just went black and never turned on again. It was impossible to reach customer service. It requires way too many apps... you have to download software to your computer to do software updates, but the application isn’t compatible with older computers. Very annoying. There is also an app that you can download on your phone, but it doesn’t sync up with the app on your computer. It is very inefficient and makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Parts
customer_reviews.text: I've already returned one Spartan Trainer Watch and now my window closed yesterday for warranty and the same thing broke. The wrist band is attached to the watch with plastic brackets to screw into. Just taking the watch off this morning to charge, it broke again. Poor design. Watch itself is great but it's useless without being able to wear it. Don't waste your time or money on buying this watch unless they make it more durable for an active lifestyle...
customer_reviews.author: Christine D. Paris

customer_reviews.title: Good features, reasonable price, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this training/racing watch but I just couldn't read it well during training and racing on trails and roads with sunglasses. The colors were muted and the fonts did not work for my eyes. Too bad as I'm a Sunnto fan!
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Watch Case Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: 1st, for the cost of this watch the features are acceptable. The new SUUNTO app, however, is not as sophisticated as the previous MovesCount, and it's a head scratcher to me as to why they changed. My big complaint, however, is that the brackets that hold the watch band to the watch case break easily. Research it and see for yourself (as I did after the fact.) SUUNTO replaced the watch case without any hassles. They said the watches made in 2018 have a defect. Then why not pull them from retail stocks!!?? Supposedly , you can tell by the serial number, the first two digits being 18.
customer_reviews.author: daguilla

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, not so good pairing app
customer_reviews.text: If you can get past the outdated Movescount app for the phone that accompanies the watch and the fact that you have to press buttons, this is a great watch. Why - because, the readings are very accurate and battery life is awesome, looks good too. It does what it is supposed to and pairs well for notifications. Very happy with the product. 4 stars and not 5 because of the bad Movescount app for the phone...
customer_reviews.author: Sri

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as an early Christmas gift. He wanted something for walking, hiking, biking, kayaking and hunting. He loves the GPS map that shows where he has been. It has a pedometer as well. The only complaint he has is during a designated activity, liking cycling, he says he can't get back to the watch to see the time of day. I find this hard to believe so if anyone reading this is aware of how to do this please let us know
customer_reviews.author: Katanajo

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this watch
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch. I was seeking an alternative to the Apple Watch, something more geared to cycling. The watch was very attractive out of the box. Looks solid and well made. The whole thing is heavy and the strap does not flex enough to fit my wrist without a big gap on either side. (I’m a medium framed woman). I was willing to deal with that until I tried to make the Suunto app(s) sync with the watch. The watch went dead (with 99% charge) and stayed dead for hours while the app appeared to attempt a set up. Eventually my fully charged phone died waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen Nieminen

customer_reviews.title: less technologically savvy watches but I googled best watches for biking and this was one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday. He has recently started road biking and more hardcore mountain biking and was looking for a heart monitor for when he is riding. He was looking at less expensive, less technologically savvy watches but I googled best watches for biking and this was one of the best. He really likes it and likes that he also can receive text messages and see who's calling just by looking at his wrist! Would highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer gardner

customer_reviews.title: Weak band/ watch head connection
customer_reviews.text: Like others have mentioned, this watch/ band connection has broken twice and had to be replaced. One of the times it broke, I was sleeping. The other time, I was walking. Cust service has been ok, got both replaced. But this last time, it took 6 weeks. The RMA took 3 weeks to get be able to return it, then 4 weeks to fix it. In 1 years time, I have physically had the watch 9 mos. I am not rough on equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less one year, watch and band are broken and suunto doesn't respond. how i get support?
customer_reviews.text: Worst service ever More than one month i sent to technical support, the status is the same"received" and i have not received any estimated date to receive back (and fixed) Less one year, the watch and band are broken and suunto doesn't respond. I still have warranty but how i get support?
customer_reviews.author: JOSE L.

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after three months
customer_reviews.text: After three months the part of the hard casing on the watch face which holds the rubber strap in place failed while on my wrist. I wasn't exercising at the time. It just fell apart. On top of this, Suunto have said that as I bought it on Amazon, they will not honor the warranty. Avoid this watch and buying on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Oisín

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy any suunto watches
customer_reviews.text: This watch is garbage. It literally fell apart after 6 weeks of moderate level use. Foolishly I replaced a suunto 3 fitness that couldn’t accurately capture any metrics with this. Also their customer service sucks, they wouldn’t take back the 3 fitness after 4 months, fortunately amazon did.
customer_reviews.author: WCM

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch for Multiple Activities
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this watch! I have tested it out now with swimming, running, treadmill, cycling, stationary biking, and circuit workouts. I'm not a huge tech person and this was easy to figure out and had everything I wanted and needed in a watch. I have rarely had a few issues with it accurately capturing heart rate, but this usually resolves within a few minutes. So happy I made this purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Battery indicator has issues
customer_reviews.text: I received my watch with battery issues. The battery indicator never shows the actual battery level of the watch. It never charges to 100% and plugging the watch into the PC would change the battery level instantly. Usually it'd show the battery to be much lower than what the watch shows. For example, I would see my watch is at 80%, then I plug it into my PC, and SuuntoLink will show the battery level to be 57%. This will then update the watch to show it at 57%. Doing a full discharge to recharge and a factory reset did not resolve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: sweetunicorn

customer_reviews.title: A training/fitness watch that doesn't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch with just about every training feature an amateur could want. Picks up GPS signal quickly and the tracking appears pretty accurate. Linking to the phone app is easy and works great. I haven't had much luck getting my watch to sync with my computer based account - but the phone app has plenty of info for the average user.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Deal

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've used this watch for one week now and it is better than I expected. I only gave 4 stars because it hasn't been long enough yet but so far it has been great. It synced with my Samsung phone fairly easy. I was also able to set up a profile online with Movescount fairly easy to download my activity on my laptop. I use it mainly for running but used it once biking (road). The watch is easy to set up and navigate. It's been a while since I've bought a GPS watch so its very nice to not have to wait for a satellite signal before I can get running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not give accurate data
customer_reviews.text: Specially for swimming Openwater ...GPS , distance and performance results do not mark correctly and are not accurate. I don’t recommend it. I also called Suunto for warranty and they keep playing me around and have no real solution.
customer_reviews.author: danella

customer_reviews.title: Performance does NOT match fancy look
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT buy this again. The optic sensor is unreliable, so I had to purchase the Smart Belt. The device does a poor job tracking my sleep, gets it accurate about 20% of the time. Counting steps is off the mark. Go for a 5.5 km hike, that is what the watch tells me, and am informed I've only made 2,000 steps. WTF!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: color is great (white and gold)
customer_reviews.text: I've got a suunto traverse alpha and bought the Spartan trainer as a gift for my girlfriend. It's light, color is great (white and gold), and seems to be working wonderfully. Only drawback to the watch is the screen; it's dim and resolution isn't great. However, this does keep the overall cost down and helps improve battery life - a trade-off I'm willing to take.
customer_reviews.author: Waffle

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for the past two months and like it a lot. The only downside is that it is a little bit big for my wrist. But I have tiny wrist it is difficult to find a sport watch with similar functionalties that is not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: hellomai

customer_reviews.title: it REALLY sucks.
customer_reviews.text: If you like a watch that shows your heart rate 50bps higher than reality, can't count swimming laps correctly, and breaks so that a band cannot be re-attached, then you'll love this watch. Oh, and when you call the customer service line, you get a BUSY signal! I should have stayed with Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: matthew cain

customer_reviews.title: A great choice considering the price and its functionalities.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very decent device. Support for lots of sport. Although most people will use just a fraction of them, it is a useful and versatile choice. Measurements for running have shown to be accurate for me. I am still to test it for swimming. For the price, a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: George Lima

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful watch until it started to randomly freeze. The solution seems to be to let it sit until the battery dies then recharge it. Not my idea of a quality product. It only lasted 10 months. Sad to see it go. Sad to see my money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the strap is horrible. I have worn it for almost 8 months, just a couple of days a week, and the strap broke in its union to the case
customer_reviews.author: VICTOR FLORES

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Ambit2R
customer_reviews.text: Epic. Had an ambit 2r and lost it, this is wonderful to have the breadcrumbs and the track-back feature for same price point. Love the new band, and it’s a lower profile than the ambit series. Would buy again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Grant lighthouse

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for runs where it's wet or you just don't need your phone tagging along. Simple and easy to use, and much better interface with the new Suunto App.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sports watch
customer_reviews.text: Like! It is light, looks good, good companion for sports. It is as not as big as the Suinto Ambit I used to use and the belt is less stiff. On the other hand, the heart rate measurem is not that accurate, compared to using a chest band. Overall, Very good watch to have.
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS MONTALVAN

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life, poor tracking on treadmill.
customer_reviews.text: Outdoor use seems ok. Indoor use on treadmill is very bad for tracking steps.
customer_reviews.author: CapnCrunch

customer_reviews.title: but because of it's useful functions and sleek look
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly. Simple, clean look that exceeded my expectations. Originally I purchased this for monitoring my performance while hiking, but because of it's useful functions and sleek look, I am now using it as my daily watch.
customer_reviews.author: Nighttrain

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wrist sensor not accurate. Takes a long time to upload workouts to phone/net.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: First three months were great
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this watch until the eyelets on the casing both broke during a hike. I called Suunto and looks like I will have to be without a watch for 3-4 weeks. I'll add to review if this continues to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Deena Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile watch strap
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a few months ago and the watch strap has already broken despite normal use and compliance with the recommendations. Used to Suunto dive computers and never had anything to complain about, but with these one i am very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking watch for all day, everyday wear!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch because it had all features that I was looking for. Great preloaded features, nice looking watch . I picked this one vs Garmin’s 935 because Garmin seemed so cheaply made.i really wanted Fenix 5 but it is just so huge. This is a nice compromise! The reason why I didn’t give 5 stars is because the screen is not as bright as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Dusko Klipa

customer_reviews.title: Fav fit watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Best watch of this type I have ever purchased. Will remain a Suunto owner for now on. Perfect for tracking exercise. Use it everyday for gym, running, and whichever event I plan to do. The charge is good and charges even better.
customer_reviews.author: JordanT

customer_reviews.title: Exercise and sleep tracker, works great!!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is made of high quality materials that have impressed me thus far. I’ve had the watch for almost 4 months and highly recommend it. I only use it for fitness and don’t receive any notifications from my phone, but as a fitness watch, it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Can break due to water and tear but it’s a great watch
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and he loves it. Great watch hope last years to come
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Poor implementation
customer_reviews.text: This product seems unfinished, both the watch and the software applications to support it. Customer support is lacking also. The Fitbit Ionic is a much superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis C.

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Watch broke where band meets the watch and unable to repair. Happened on day 91 of use.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Poor band quality and design.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Spartan Trainer. The first one had a band break after one month, the replacement only lasted a week. I’m extremely disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine L. Friddle

customer_reviews.title: reliable and smaller hr gps sportwatch
customer_reviews.text: it is reliable and easy to use and really smaller than other spartans and garmin fenix series if screen brightness can be change manually it would be better
customer_reviews.author: hakan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job (for people workout on a dailly basis - this is not a tactical or outdoor watch) and gets UG's nearly every 2 months. So, why paying much more? May be it's a personal problem for me the strap smells after working out.
customer_reviews.author: Mehmet Atalay

customer_reviews.title: steps
customer_reviews.text: nor sure why the steps are so high but other wise I love it.....bought 3 for my work out partners
customer_reviews.author: Toya Harley

customer_reviews.title: I love it !
customer_reviews.text: I’m not heavy user, but the multi functionality is suitable for my behavior. Sandstone color looks nice even in the streets.
customer_reviews.author: Angsumarin

customer_reviews.title: great workout watch
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a Suunto spartan fan/owner, you know what to expect. If not, great workout watch. Plenty of options and in-depth analysis on movescount. Doesn’t have a huge battery though so keep it to day to day workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: Best all around sportswatch
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and very functional. I use it everyday either running, swinming or cycling. Great all around product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Sanchez-Artola

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!!!!!!! Haven’t even had it one week and already froze up and stopped working. Piece of junk! DO NOT ORDER!
customer_reviews.author: stephen bukky

customer_reviews.title: Bad product , pls don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The strap holder broke in 3 months time !! I can't use the watch anymore
customer_reviews.author: Monish Anand

customer_reviews.title: 11 months purchased
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, any sport! BUT AFTER 11 months of purchase this is what happened...
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: watch works great gps on you wrist awesome
customer_reviews.text: watch works great gps on you wrist awesome. If you have been thinking of one of this get it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S.

customer_reviews.title: Good option
customer_reviews.text: A good wristwatch for beginners with all that the athlete needs
customer_reviews.author: khaled murad

customer_reviews.title: Best sport watch I ever own
customer_reviews.text: Best sport watch I ever own. I’m just afraid to break the wrist band when I bang it against thing.
customer_reviews.author: Juan De la Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Some improvements on user interface could help but overall a pleasant sports device
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch size, not too thick/ wide. I like using it for runnig, good accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: Fajar

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the watch's functions as they suit my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the watch's functions as they suit my needs. Caveat: If you want to track sleep, get something else (I use FitBit Charge 2 for that). My only beef with the watch is the actual color of the watch. I was disappointed when I opened the box. The photos on the Suunto website are misleading. They use more saturated photos of the watch leading one to think the color is darker than what you get. The photos on the Amazon page are slightly more accurate. However, the actual watch color is more of a washed-out off-white green. If you want a bold color, choose something other than Ocean.
customer_reviews.author: TMK

customer_reviews.title: Very functional and happy with its performance
customer_reviews.text: Heavier/bigger than anticipated but I have small wrists(hence the 4 stars). Very functional and happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Ekeroth

customer_reviews.title: Not what I have expected.
customer_reviews.text: Do not pull workouts from training peaks. Do not send HR data into zwift.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best Daily Watch in design way, size way, function way
customer_reviews.author: sujin lee

customer_reviews.title: Bad Watch
customer_reviews.text: Bad purchase! Heart rate is not accurate at all. I don’t recommend this watch. Waist money.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Eduardo Zuniga

product_meta.title: SUUNTO Spartan Trainer Wrist HR
product_meta.description: Suunto Spartan Trainer Wrist HR :: Suunto Spartan Trainer is a beautifully designed GPS watch with optimal fit, ready to train how you want whether you swim, cycle, hit the gym or run trails. Featuring convenient wrist HR measurement, the Trainer tracks your activity with calories and steps 24/7. Versatile sport and outdoor features make Spartan Trainer a natural partner as you push the city limits and your own!
feature_bullets: Battery life up to 10 hours in training mode
GPS tracking with speed, pace, and distance
Ready for all your sports: swimming, running, cycling, gym, hiking, and more
Compact size and optimal fit for sports and daily wear

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
